column1: A very tall and strong man
column3: came down to meet Theseus. On his arms were golden bracelets
column4: and round his neck a collar of jewels; and he came forward
column6: and held out both his hands
column9: to these mountains; happy am I to have met you! For what greater pleasure to a good man than to entertain strangers? But I see that you are weary. Come up to my castle
column10: and rest yourself awhile.""I give you thanks
column11: said Theseus; but am in haste to go up the valley.""Alas! you have wandered far from the right way
column12: and you cannot reach your journey's end to-night
column13: for there are many miles of mountain between you and it
column15: and cliffs dangerous after nightfall. It is well for you that I met you
column16: for my whole joy is to find strangers
column17: and to feast them at my castle
column18: and hear tales from them of foreign lands. Come up with me
column19: and eat the best of venison
column20: and drink the rich red wine
column21: and sleep upon my famous bed
column22: of which all travellers say that they never saw the like.
